page.title: 01ST.THOMAS-IDE, EXETER,1985.
page.content: The area stretches from the river Exe, through the residential area around Cowick Street, westwards to the village of Ide. In the south of the area is the trading estate and north wards, beyond the large housing estates is mainly countryside. Building development, over the years, has gradually encroached on the farm land. Many local people find their employment and recreation in the area. There are medical centres, parks, pubs, nightclubs, social clubs, and many sport and leisure amenities. There are many shops, so there is really no need to cross the river into Exeter. Next year will see a leisure centre in the area and this will bring many visitors. The main roads and railways carry much of the traffic to south and west Devon and also the Cornish traffic.
